name: biomni-query-geo
title: Biomni: Query Geo
description: Query NCBI's Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) for functional genomics data including gene expression microarray and RNA-seq datasets.
content:
Overview

Searches GEO, the world's largest public repository for gene expression and functional genomics data. GEO contains over 5 million samples from microarray, RNA-seq, ChIP-seq, and other high-throughput experiments across thousands of studies and conditions.

Input Parameters

  • prompt (string, optional): Natural language query about expression data or experiments
  • search_term (string, optional): Direct search term or GEO accession (e.g., "GSE12345")
  • max_results (integer, optional): Maximum number of results to return (default: 3)

Input Format

Create a JSON file with the following structure:

{
  "prompt": "Find breast cancer RNA-seq datasets",
  "search_term": "breast cancer[disease] AND RNA-seq[assay type]",
  "max_results": 10
}

Biological Use Case

Critical for transcriptomics research, meta-analysis studies, and biomarker discovery. Researchers use GEO to find relevant expression datasets, compare gene expression across conditions, validate experimental findings, identify co-expressed genes, and discover disease-associated expression signatures. Essential for systems biology and translational research.

Output

Returns a JSON file (geo_results.json) containing dataset information including GEO accessions (GSE/GSM), study titles, sample descriptions, experimental conditions, platform information, publication references, and links to download raw and processed expression data.

Category

database
